goal.tools.adapt

Class QLearner

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.adapt.QLearner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LearnerAlgorithm, java.io.Serializable

    public class QLearner
extends java.lang.Object
implements LearnerAlgorithm
    The default learner to use. This is a simple Q-Learner. see also http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-learning. Note: although some of the files have the name 'sarsa', SARSA is a different learning algorithm.
    Author:
    dsingh, W.Pasman modified name. Fixed serialization. #2246
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • nextAction

        public java.lang.Integer nextAction(java.lang.Integer state,
                           java.lang.Integer[] actions)
        Description copied from interface: LearnerAlgorithm
        ask the learner which action to execute next. Learner should return action or null.
        Specified by:
        nextAction in interface LearnerAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        state - is the current state number. See FileLearner.stateid
        actions - is an array with the possible actions at this point. see FileLearner.actionid.
        Returns:
        returns the action index to be executed in the next action. next action or null if no action is available.

      • update

        public void update(double reward,

        Description copied from interface: LearnerAlgorithm
        This is called after each action of the agent.
        Specified by:
        update in interface LearnerAlgorithm
        Parameters:
        reward - The reward is as indicated by MentalState#getReward().
        resultingstate - a state number, see FileLearner.stateid
